div.l: But specially I pray the oste dere
Gete vs som mete ⁊and drynke ⁊and make vs chere
And we wol paye treuly at the full
Wᵗith empty hond men may non haukes tyll
Lo here oure seluer for to spende
¶ The myller to the toıı̄un his doughter sende
For ale ⁊and bred ⁊and rosted hem a goos
And tyed hur͗e hors he shulde no more go loos
In his owne chambre he made a bed
Wᵗith shetes ⁊and clothes ful feyre ⁊and wel y spred
Not fro his owne bed · x · fote or twelfe
His doughter hed a bed al bi hur selfe
Right in the same chambre bi ⁊and by
Hit mighte be no bet ⁊and the cause why
Ther͗e was no romer berberewe in that place
Thei sowped ⁊and spak hem to solace
And dronk ouer strong ale at the best
Aboute mydnyght wente thei to rest
¶ Wel hath this myller vernesshened his hed
Ful pale he was for dronken ⁊and not red
He bosteth ⁊and speketh thrugh the nose
As he were on the quat ⁊and on the pose
To bedde he goth ⁊and wᵗith him goth his wyf
As eny Iay was he light ⁊and Iolyf
So was his Ioly whistell wel y wet
The cradell at the chambre dore was set
To rocken ⁊and to yeue the chyld sowke
And when that dronken was al the crowke
To bedde wente the doughter a non
To bedde goth Aleyne ⁊and Also Iohn
